title: Cannot Login to client
body:
When I open League of Legends, it gets stuck on the flash page for a few minutes, then after a grey bar appears under the flash page for a minute, the client opens. Takes about 5 minutes to authenticate, then I can launch. When I get to the login page, it tells me that I cannot sign in and that I may be offline. That lasts for about a minute and then I can login. When I finally get to the main client, I can't play a game. When I click the button, it says the client is patching. When I mouse over the patching bar, it tells me that there was an error and I need to restart the client. So I did, hesitantly, and guess what? The exact same process. 

None of this is typical. Restarting my machine did not help. 
Windows 10

Edit: Now it is stuck on the authentication screen. Calculating differences at 33%

Edit 2: I reinstalled the client. Opens quickly now, but says I cannot login to the authentication server. Checked the servers, all green.

Edit 3: Got back into client, got the same error as before, asking me to restart. Left client open for about 10-15 minutes and it eventually fixed itself and allowed me to create a lobby. Still, the issue needs to be addressed. I had time to play a couple ARAMs before. That is no longer the case now and I wont be able to play at all.

replies.body:
Sounds like you got caught in a patching loop due to the patch not being able to fully download. It sounds like you were finally able to get a solid connection and got that patch going though!

If that happens in the future, a good first step would be checking some of your [**network settings**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) and making sure to update any port forwarding and flush your DNS.
